title: Quarto Basics
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 4 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()







Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis.

title: Quarto Basics
text:
Running a test
Does this update on demand if I type in here and save?

# Omg it does, if I type code here and save, it appears in the local host 

This is a game changer! I can see immediately the results of my code and have it output to a live server to see how it will render :D

title: Quarto Basics
text:
Another test of an update
How do this one go?
If I push a commit to main, does this appear on the website?

title: Quarto Basics
text:
How does this work?
Can I deploy from nested folders?
I’d like to keep the root/ dir nice and clean.

title: Quarto Basics
text:
Onto the code…
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 4 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()







Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis.
